name: Cucumber - Iznik
description: Iznik produces good yields of 3 1/2–4ֿֿ" spineless, seedless, dark green snack cucumbers. Multiple fruits per node. Excellent flavor. Pick daily for best quality. Gynoecious and parthenocarpic. High resistance to powdery mildew and scab.

name: Tomato - Sunrise
description: Gorgeous combination of yellows and reds, inside and out. Excellent sweet and tangy flavor. Adds a nice pop of color to any mix, but also stands alone as a premium-quality cherry for snacking and salads.

name: Tomato - Bigdena
description: Vigorous, open plants produce very high yields of uniform, 8-12 oz. red fruits that are mostly smooth with slight shoulder ribs. Very good flavor with nice internal color and quality.

name: Tomato - Beorange
description: Great flavor with a better balance of acid and sweetness than most orange tomatoes. Beorange is bred with the vigor and disease resistance to stand up to a long season in the greenhouse. 6-8 oz. fruits are firm but not hard, nor prone to cracking or other blemishes. Eye-catching, deep orange color.

name: Arugula - Esmee
description: Similar to Surrey, but organic, and with a much rounder oakleaf. Also has an attractive, three-dimensional texture. Esmee helps increase loft; salad "stands tall on the plate." Excellent flavor.

name: Chard - Bright Lights
description: Lightly savoyed green or bronze leaves with stems of gold, pink, orange, purple, red, and white with bright and pastel variations. Consistent growth rate and strong bolt resistance across all colors makes this a superior mix. Suitable for production year round, but somewhat less frost hardy than normal for chard.

name: Mustard Greens - Red Giant
description: Popular ֿ"red" mustard from Japan. Large, purple-tinted leaves. Mild mustard flavor.

name: Claytonia - Special
description: Succulent, cold-hardy salad green. Quantities of heart-shaped leaf pairs, each "wrapped" around a white-flowered stem. Hardiest of the winter salad greens, can tolerate moderate frost and can be grown all winter in mild regions or in cold greenhouses. The taste of the young leaves is wild and fresh. Suitable for multiple cuttings.

name: Basil - Green & Red Mix
description: Classic Italian variety. Authentic flavor and appearance. Tall and relatively slow to bolt with large dark-green leaves about 3" long. This common strain of Genovese basil can present some variability in leaf shape and plant size.

name: Parsley - Celery Flavored
description: A curled-leaf cutting celery. A novelty for fresh market sales. Looks like a cross between cutting celery and curled-leaf parsley. Celery flavor. Much easier to grow than standard celery. Also known as leaf celery.

name: Parsley - Wega
description: Highly uniform and refined curled parsley variety. Wega's upright habit makes it easy to harvest the dark green leaves.

name: Mustard Greens - Greenwave
description: Bright green, broad leaves with a tightly scalloped margin and hot, mustardy flavor.

name: Arugula - Astro
description: A selection of standard arugula with a more strap-leaf shape and a slightly milder flavor. Edible Flowers: Harvest the white flowers with dark-pink veins as they appear. Flavor is spicy and nutty.

name: Cilantro - Santo
description: Santo is a slow-bolting selection grown for its leaves. Like the leaves and seeds, the flowers are also edible.

name: Pac Choi - Mei Qing Choi
description: Flat, pale, misty-green stems form a thick, heavy base with broad, oval, rich green leaves. The compact, vase-shaped plant at full size is about 8–10" tall, but also well-formed at mini size when young. Good bolt, heat, and cold tolerance.

name: Lettuce - Green Butter
description: Dense rosette heads with attractive, thin, supple leaves. Darker green color and more upright growth habit. Heads have a round base with open leaves. Delicate, buttery flavor. Great for salad mix.

name: Lettuce - Red Butter
description: Dense rosette heads with attractive, thin, supple leaves. Conventional seed with NOP-compliant pelleting. Triple red heads have a round base with open leaves. Attractive red to green color transition. Delicate, buttery flavor. Great for salad mix.

name: Lettuce - Green Sweet Crisp
description: Sweet flavor and crunchy, crisp, succulent leaves. Medium-dark green leaves with a very defined, three-dimensional shape. Sweet, almost romaine-like flavor, with a crisp, almost iceberg-like, texture. Large, heavy heads are slow to bolt.

name: Lettuce - Green Oakleaf
description: Compact, Exceptionally high leaf count with well-refined lobing and better uniformity than similar varieties. Proven to perform well across various indoor setups. The leaves are shiny with a glossy medium-to-dark green coloration.

name: Lettuce - Romain
description: Very upright, easy to grow, and adaptable to all seasons. Attractive dark green, savoyed leaves that blanch at the center. This variety is extremely slow to bolt and exceptionally tipburn tolerant. A cross between romaine and iceberg with good weight and crunch for its size. Great in salad mix.

name: Lettuce - Cherokee
description: Thick, crisp, dark red leaves with good flavor. Similar appearance to Magenta except much darker red color, though not quite as sweet. Very slow bolting with excellent tolerance to heat and bottom rot.

name: Kohlrabi - Green
description: Early, uniform, and great tasting. The best all-around kohlrabi we've found. Remarkable uniformity, texture, and flavor even past typical market size. Exceptionally sweet and mild. Holds a long time in the field without getting woody. Small petiole attachment makes for easier stripping and peeling.

name: Kohlrabi - Red
description: Prettiest, most uniform purple variety. 3" bulbs with uniform, deep-purple skin and nearly fiberless, crisp white flesh.

name: Arugula
description: Known as salad rocket and feature elongated,Lobular with prominent green veins. Posesses a mustard like spicy flavour that blends in salads and sandwiches.

name: Basil - Geronimo
description: Ideal for refining Mediterranean dishes or making aromatic pestos. Pleasant full-bodied basil flavor.

name: Parsley - Plain
description: Feature short, erect and vigorous plant with large, flat dark green leaves.Provides special flavour to salads and dishes and can be mixed in almost every recipe.

name: Cilantro
description: Soft hairless dark green leaves. The leaves and the stem has a mildly citrus flavor.Provides high leaf yield and can blend in any recipe from soup,salad and casserole. recomended to use while fresh.

name: Lettuce - Salanova Sartre
description: Medium green color, medium size head, beautiful rosette shaped head. High number of small leaves ideal for salad mixes.

name: Lettuce - Salanova Gaugen
description: Yellow-green-red in one, very pretty colour contrast, many uniform, small thick leaves
